project_name: Aguadilla Military Facility In Aguadilla Renovation
description: Renovation of a military facility in Aguadilla, Puerto Rico. Completed plans call for the renovation of a military facility. Remove existing kitchen cabinets and install new PVC and laminated cabinets, along with floating floor installation throughout the house unit at USCG Housing. The contractor shall provide all labor, materials, equipment, tools, and supervision necessary for the work. Cabinet removal includes clearing the kitchen, disconnecting utilities, and disposing of old cabinets. Installation involves securing base and wall cabinets, aligning doors and hardware, and finishing with toe kicks and crown molding. Floating floor installation requires subfloor preparation, underlayment placement, plank installation with expansion gaps, and final cleaning. The contractor must also handle cleanup, final inspection, and provide care instructions for installed materials. Work must be completed within 15 days of notice to proceed, including submittal reviews and project closeout. Safet
reasoning: The project involves a renovation of a military facility {Aguadilla Military Facility In Aguadilla Renovation}. While the primary focus is on kitchen cabinets and flooring, it implies interior construction work. The bid due date of September 13, 2025 ({}) suggests an active procurement and near-term timeline for contractors to engage.

description: Renovation of a transportation facility in Miami, Florida. Completed plans call for the renovation of a transportation facility. SCOPE OF WORK: This project involves removing and installing seventy-one (71) fire-rated three-hour (3) stainless steel doors, frames, hinges, including all hardware listed. Door, frame, and hardware must have the same fire-resistance rating of three hours. The contractor is responsible for ordering the new door with the same lock configuration as the existing door. The contractor is responsible for obtaining the Miami-Dade Building Department permit. Sixty- one (61) single doors and ten (10) double doors need to be replaced, for a total of seventy- one (71) doors. The sizes of single and double doors vary. The contractor is responsible for measuring each Metro Rail and Metro Mover station door that will be replaced. description:
This is a service / maintenance or supply contract in Marathon, Florida. Contact the soliciting agency for additional information. 70Z028-25-Q-BMBMARATHONLANDSCAPING The U.S. Coast Guard Base Miami Beach requires recurring tree care, landscaping, lawn maintenance, and shrubbery maintenance services for Grassy Key Housing in Marathon, Florida. Services must be performed in accordance with the attached Statement of Work (SOW). This is a firm-fixed-price service contract awarded using simplified acquisition procedures under FAR Parts 12 and 13. The evaluation will be conducted on a Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) basis, considering technical capability, past performance, and price. The contract includes a base year period of performance from date of award through August 31, 2026. Vendors must be registered in SAM.gov prior to award, and invoices will be submitted through the Invoice Processing Platform (IPP).

description: Site work for a water / sewer project in Sunrise, Florida. Completed plans call for site work for a water / sewer project.The Stormwater Pump Station No. 5 is located at 9140 Sunrise Lakes Boulevard. It services drainage basin No. 5, which is approximately 312 acres and is bounded by Pine Island Road on the east, Nob Hill Road on the west, the South Florida Water Management District C-13 Canal on the north, and Northwest 27th Street on the south. This stormwater pumping station, constructed in 1973, has reached the end of its service life and requires replacement. The City of Sunrise requires a qualified Contractor to demolish the existing station, filling the stilling pond adjacent to it, and constructing the new station.
